high_level_goal: Create a multi-agent system user interface using the runtime package, supporting sysmain CLIs arguments, based on PyQt6.
reasoning: The goal requires a multi-agent system to be developed. This plan breaks down the process into logical steps, assigning roles and agents to each task, ensuring all aspects from design to implementation are covered. The plan leverages the provided team members and their specified goals to achieve the high-level objective.

roles.title: Task-Agnostic Step (TAS) Extractor
roles.purpose: Identify and extract granular, task-agnostic steps from the high-level goal.

roles.title: Prompt Engineer
roles.purpose: Structure workflows, ensure clarity in agent instructions, and engineer system prompts for optimal agent performance.

roles.title: Designer
roles.purpose: Generate aesthetic layouts, color palettes, typography, and UI flows, ensuring accessibility and visual balance for the user interface.

roles.title: Engineer
roles.purpose: Implement designs into clean, modular, and performant code, focusing on responsive design, accessibility, and integration with the runtime package and sysmain CLIs.

tasks.description: Deconstruct the high-level goal into a series of Task-Agnostic Steps (TAS). This involves identifying the core components and actions required to build the multi-agent system UI.
Deconstruct the high-level goal into a series of Task-Agnostic Steps (TAS). This involves identifying the core components and actions required to build the multi-agent system UI.
Deconstruct the high-level goal into a series of Task-Agnostic Steps (TAS). This involves identifying the core components and actions required to build the multi-agent system UI.
Consolidate and refine the Task-Agnostic Steps (TAS) extracted by GPTASe, TASe, and uTASe. Ensure a logical flow and identify any redundancies or missing steps.

Based on the refined TAS, define the overall architecture and user flow for the multi-agent system UI. This includes specifying the main components, their interactions, and how they will integrate with the runtime package and sysmain CLIs.
Develop the visual design elements for the UI, including layout, color schemes, typography, and iconography. Ensure the design is aesthetic, accessible, and aligns with the defined user flow.

Translate the UI design and architecture into a functional implementation using PyQt6. This involves creating the core UI components, integrating with the runtime package, and ensuring support for sysmain CLIs arguments.
Implement the logic for handling sysmain CLIs arguments within the PyQt6 application. This includes parsing arguments and configuring the application's behavior accordingly.
Integrate the developed UI components with the T20 runtime package. Ensure seamless data flow and interaction between the UI and the underlying multi-agent system.
Refine the system prompts for each agent involved in the UI development process, based on the specific tasks and requirements. Ensure clarity, conciseness, and effectiveness of instructions.
Conduct thorough testing of the multi-agent system UI. This includes functional testing, usability testing, and performance testing to ensure it meets all requirements and specifications.
Document the developed multi-agent system UI, including its architecture, features, usage instructions, and integration details with the runtime package and sysmain CLIs.
